item.description:
It's time for the first FREE classical music concert for the fall season at the New England Conservatory of Music!

Tonight, maestro Hugh Wolff, the NEC's Calderwood Director of Orchestras, kicks off NEC's Mahler Festival with the NEC Philharmonia. The performance is preceded by a lecture by Mahler scholar Dr. Katarina Markovic, Chair of NEC’s Music History and Musicology Department.  The featured work is Mahler's Symphony No. 1 ("Titan"), in a reconstructed edition of the original version premiered in Budapest in 1889. The concert marks its American premiere, and the first time this original version has been heard since its 1889 premiere.  The symphony is paired with Richard Strauss's tone poem Don Juan, which had its premiere the same year as the Mahler in 1889.

For more information about this concert, go to http://necmusic.edu/first-mahler.

Note: The concert is on a Monday starts a half hour EARLIER THAN USUAL at 7:30pm, so let's meet up at 7:00pm, so the group has a chance to get good seats and socialize before the concert.  On opening night, we usually end up sitting in left-middle section of the balcony, since this affords a good view of the entire orchestra, is open to the ceiling, and is easy to describe and find, and it is relatively easy to grab a large block of seats there.

Note: Due to Meetup's terrible decision to remove the Maybe option, please indicate whether you are a maybe in your Yes RSVP. (and please write to Meetup here if you want to register your displeasure with that decision!)

Directions to Jordan Hall:
The hall is located at the corner of Huntington and Gainsborough streets, about a block south of the Symphony T stop on the Green Line. Look for the building with the YMCA sign on top of it--it's near that building. The main entrance is reached from Gainsborough Street.

This evening's program will include:

  • Mahler: Symphony No. 1 in D major (listen to the 1st movement here and the 3rd movement here)
  • R. Strauss: Don Juan, Op. 20 (listen to the 1st part here)
item.how_to_find_us: I will stand in the lobby until 7:15, after which I will join the group upstairs in the left-middle balcony section.
item.name: NEC Classical Concert Series Opener: Wolff conducts Mahler's 1st Symphony
